act_summary: This section of the Companies Act 2013 regulates the articles of association (articles) of a company, which must include regulations for management and may contain provisions for entrenchment. The articles must be in specified forms and comply with certain requirements such as being registered under this Act or any previous law applicable to the company. Amendments to the articles require notice to the Registrar and approval by all members or special resolution.
